sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But BioNTech says it will know in two weeks if its current Pfizer vaccine is effective against Omicron. If not, it hopes to alter its formula to match the new variant.

sentences.sentence: This is a long-term problem. How long are these coastal patrols going to be able to be kept up? Days, weeks, months? This is an ongoing problem. We need a long-term, sustainable solution.

French President Emmanuel Macron and Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi have signed a new pact aiming to strengthen ties across a broad range of areas. The Quirinale Treaty comes after tensions in recent years over sensitive issues including migration and Libya.

sentences.sentence: Ukraine's president has claimed his country's intelligence service has uncovered plans to topple him in a coup backed by Russia.

sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelensky said he'd been told a military takeover was being planned for next week, but he told reporters he would face it down.

sentences.sentence: We have complete control of our borders, and we're fully prepared for any escalation.

sentences.sentence: Zelensky said he had audio recordings of a meeting to plan the coup allegedly involving Ukraine's richest oligarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Russia denies the allegations.

sentences.sentence: But as tensions rise on the front line separating Ukrainian forces from Russian-backed separatists, NATO said it was keeping a close eye.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So we are monitoring this very closely we collect information we share information and we also send a clear message to Russia that they need to de-escalate to reduce tensions to be transparent and also that any use of force against Ukraine will have consequences, will have costs for Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: A court case to decide the fate of Russia's premier human rights group, Memorial, began

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: in Moscow on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The group are accused of violating Russia's foreign agents law, a piece of legislation that the government has increasingly used to crack down on people and parties it deems unfriendly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Memorial came under the spotlight of the authorities following its support of jailed Putin critic Alexei Navalny.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Prosecutors accused Memorial of systematically failing to use the foreign agent label.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Every month the authorities declare some people to be foreign agents or they open criminal cases against them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But the fact that the state is trying to shut down Memorial, to shut down our collective memory, that's really shocking and really scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Memorial plays a huge role in our country. This organisation above all studies history, repressions in our country. It's a page in our history the authorities are trying to turn and forget. They only want to be proud of our victories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The authorities have gone beyond the realm of reason and we understand that beyond reason absolutely anything can happen.
